titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. E. H. Daniels and Reuben T. Daniels, Indictment
CWG7544

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } June Term 1865
E H Daniels & Reuben T Daniels

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse E,, H Daniels and Reuben T Daniels of the offence of allowing gaming in a house committed as follows. viz= The said E H Daniels and Reuben T Daniels on the 10th day of January 1865, and on divers other days and times before and Since that time in the County aforesaid,, did,, willfully and Knowingly suffer permit and allow games of chance,, on a gaming Table called a Jenny Lind Table,, and with cards and other games of chance to be played in a house in their possession occupation and under their control, at which said games of chance money property and divers other things of value were bett wagered won and lost on said games of chance aforesaid and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

J W McCoy
Foreman Grand Jury
E P Campbell, Attorney for the Commonwealth

A Copy
attest J C Barnes Clk
By F W Dabney D C

Information given by,
A,, C,, Mayes,,
George Coon
Perry Blount
Wm T, Scott,
Wm H Owen
Frank W Dabney
D H Wylie
J J Wylie,

Comlth
,,vs,, } Indictment for permitting gaming in a house
Daniels & Daniels
a true bill
J. W. McCoy
foreman grand Jury.
Filed & noted in open court June 12th 1865.
att F W Dabney D C
Issd
a copy
for 30,Â¢ Campbell atty
